summary: The blog post discusses the use of cloud technologies and AI for processing medical text on Google Cloud, focusing on the extraction of structured data from unstructured clinical records. It also covers the use of Google Cloud's Vertex Workbench Jupyter Notebooks, Healthcare Natural Language API, BigQuery, Looker Dashboard, and Vertex AI AutoML for this purpose.
takeaways: Real world evidence (RWE) can be used to accelerate the drug approval process, and cloud technologies and AI can help mitigate the need for placebos in some clinical trials.
Unstructured medical data can lead to increased care gaps and variances, and human abstraction alone is not fast or accurate enough to abstract all patient data.
Google Cloud's Healthcare Natural Language API offers efficient medical text entity resolution at scale and incorporates human-in-the-loop abstraction assisted by machine learning.

The solution involves using Document AI for data ingestion, NLP for natural language processing, Vertex AI AutoML for dataset labeling, BigQuery for data storage, and Looker Dashboard for visualization and decision support.
The blog post highlights the potential for future topics, such as creating a biomedical knowledge graph and exploring rich relationships from the Healthcare Natural Language API.
Data privacy and compliance with healthcare regulations, such as HIPAA, are emphasized as key considerations in the use of patient data on Google Cloud.
